Package me.dessie.dessielib.storageapi.container

Class ArrayContainer<H>

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.storageapi.container.StorageContainer
me.dessie.dessielib.storageapi.container.ArrayContainer<H>
Type Parameters:
H - The Handler type, for storing and retrieving lists from the structure. Generally, this will be some natively supported array implementation such as ArrayList.
Direct Known Subclasses:
RetrieveArrayContainer
public abstract class ArrayContainer<H> extends StorageContainer
This interface will allow easier connection with arrays, if implemented within the container. Please note, that it is the implementers' responsibility to add functionality for storing and retrieving of lists within the respective hooks.
See Also:
  • If you're creating your own ArrayContainer class. It may provide an easier way to retrieve your items with lists.

  • Method Details

    • getStoreListHandler

      protected abstract H getStoreListHandler()
      Implementation method for returning a new handler object. This handler object will be passed into your handleListObject() for each Object that is added. Usually, it should be just a new instance of whatever H is.
      Returns:
      The handler object to use.
      See Also:
      • handleListObject()

    • getRetrieveListHandler

      protected abstract H getRetrieveListHandler(String path)
      Implementation method for returning an existing handler object on the data source. This retrieved handler object will be passed into the handleRetrieveList(Object, Class) for recomposing the Objects.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to retrieve the handler instance.
      Returns:
      The existing handler object that exists at the data source path.
      See Also:
      • handleRetrieveList(Object, Class)

    • handleListObject

      protected abstract BiConsumer<H,List<Pair<String,Object>>> handleListObject()
      Handles storing a List object into the data source. When a user attempts to store a List, this method will be called for all Objects within that list. StorageDecomposers will have their path and object within the provided list. If the object isn't a StorageDecomposer, the Key in the Pair will be null. The Handler that is passed will be the same handler, and the final handler will be stored using StorageContainer.store(String, Object), passing the handler as the object.
      Returns:
      The BiConsumer that writes to your handler from the provided data.
      See Also:
      • getRetrieveListHandler(String)

    • handleRetrieveList

      protected abstract <T> List<T> handleRetrieveList(H handler, Class<T> type)
      Handles retrieving a List object from the data source. When a user attempts to retrieve a list from the container, this method will be called for handling your provided handler, and making sure objects are recomposed properly. This will generally involve parsing whatever handler your used, and converting all objects back into their original states
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of Object that the user wants the List to contain.
      Parameters:
      handler - The retrieved Handler from your data source.
      type - The Class type that the list containers. You will need to retrieve a RecomposedObject instance for all elements that will be used for recomposing your objects.
      Returns:
      A recomposed list of the requested objects from the handler.
      See Also:
      • getRetrieveListHandler(String)

    • addToList

      public <T> CompletableFuture<List<T>> addToList(Class<T> type, String path, T... objects)
      Adds objects to the list on the path. If a list does not exist at the specified path, it will be created.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of objects
      Parameters:
      type - The type of objects to add
      path - The path to the array list.
      objects - The objects to add
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that is completed once the data has been set. The Future will have the updated list.

    • removeFromList

      public <T> CompletableFuture<List<T>> removeFromList(Class<T> type, String path, T... objects)
      Removes objects from the list on the path. A list must already exist at the specified path to remove objects from it. Note that objects will only be removed from the list if Object.equals(Object) returns true.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of objects
      Parameters:
      type - The type of objects to remove
      path - The path to the array list.
      objects - The objects to remove
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that is completed once the data has been removed. The Future will have the updated list.

    • listContains

      public <T> CompletableFuture<Boolean> listContains(Class<T> type, String path, T object)
      Checks if an object exists within the array list.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the object
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the object to check for
      path - The path to the array list.
      object - The object to check the list for.
      Returns:
      A future that when completed will verify if the object exists within the provided array.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - If the array list cannot support type T.

    • retrieveList

      public <T> List<T> retrieveList(Class<T> type, String path)
      Retrieves a List directly from the data source. Please note that this method is Thread blocking.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type ob the Objects in the list.
      Parameters:
      type - The class type of Objects in the List.
      path - The path to the array list.
      Returns:
      The List of retrieved Objects.
      See Also:
      • retrieveListAsync(Class, String)
      • retrieveListOrElse(Class, String, List)

    • retrieveListAsync

      public <T> CompletableFuture<List<T>> retrieveListAsync(Class<T> type, String path)
      Retrieves a List directly from the data source asynchronously.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type ob the Objects in the list.
      Parameters:
      type - The class type of Objects in the List.
      path - The path to the array list.
      Returns:
      A future, that when completed will contain the List of retrieved Objects.
      See Also:
      • retrieveList(Class, String)
      • retrieveListOrElseAsync(Class, String, List)

    • retrieveListOrElse

      public <T> List<T> retrieveListOrElse(Class<T> type, String path, List<T> orElse)
      Retrieves a List directly from the data source, or a provided list if the path doesn't exist or returns null. Please note that this method is Thread blocking.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type ob the Objects in the list.
      Parameters:
      type - The class type of Objects in the List.
      path - The path to the array list.
      orElse - The list to return if no list was found at the provided path.
      Returns:
      The List of retrieved Objects.
      See Also:
      • retrieveListOrElseAsync(Class, String, List)

    • retrieveListOrElseAsync

      public <T> CompletableFuture<List<T>> retrieveListOrElseAsync(Class<T> type, String path, List<T> orElse)
      Retrieves a List directly from the data source asynchronously, or a provided list if the path doesn't exist or returns null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type ob the Objects in the list.
      Parameters:
      type - The class type of Objects in the List.
      path - The path to the array list.
      orElse - The list to return if no list was found at the provided path.
      Returns:
      A future, that when completed will contain the List of retrieved Objects.
      See Also:
      • retrieveListOrElse(Class, String, List)

    • handleNestedObject

      protected Object handleNestedObject(H handler, Class<?> decomposerType)
      Helper method for retrieving Lists with nested DecomposedObjects. Will return the RecomposedObject from a Handler and decomposer type.
      Parameters:
      handler - The Handler to get the nested recomposed object from
      decomposerType - The type of the recomposed object
      Returns:
      The RecomposedObject that was retrieved.

    • isListSupported

      public boolean isListSupported(Class<?> clazz)
      Determines if a class can be used within a Collection or Array to be stored. This supports Strings and Primitives by default, but can be overridden to support other types.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The type to check.
      Returns:
      If the specified class is able to be stored in a list.

    • isList

      public boolean isList(Object obj)
      Returns if the object provided is a Collection or an Array.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to check.
      Returns:
      If the object is a Collection or Array.

    • isPrimitiveList

      public boolean isPrimitiveList(Object list)
      Returns if the provided list is type of Primitive or is a String. If the provided object is not a list, false will be returned. All values must be of type primitive or String, if a single element fails, then this method will return false.
      Parameters:
      list - The list to check
      Returns:
      If the list contains primitive types, primitive wrappers or Strings.

    • getListStream

      protected Stream<Object> getListStream(Object list)
      Returns a Stream of objects from an Array or Collection from a provided arbitrary object. Returns an empty stream if the provided Object is null, or a Stream of the passed Object if it is not a List.
      Parameters:
      list - The Object to attempt to get the Stream for.
      Returns:
      The Stream of the Array/Collection.

    • handleList

      protected H handleList(Object data)
      Handles the storing of a List into the container. The list must not contain any classes or objects that cannot be stored. e.g. They must be primitives or a have a StorageDecomposer. All objects will have handleListObject() called on them with the handle.
      Parameters:
      data - The List to store, can be either an Array or a Collection.
      Returns:
      The handler that can be stored natively into the container.
      See Also:
      • getRetrieveListHandler(String)
      • handleListObject()

    • isSupported

      public boolean isSupported(Class<?> clazz)
      Description copied from class: StorageContainer
      Returns if a class is supported for storage in this container. All primitives and Strings are automatically supported. Other classes will need to have a StorageDecomposer to be considered supported.
      Overrides:
      isSupported in class StorageContainer
      Parameters:
      clazz - The type to check.
      Returns:
      If the specified class is able to be stored.
